intro: Macarthuria keigheryi, commonly known as the Keighery's macarthuria, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The species is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale pink flowers that bloom during the spring and summer seasons. It typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered plant species.
